page.title: 01HELMSHORE DISTRICT.
page.content:
Helmshore is a village in the Rossendale valley. The M66 provides access from Manchester and the M62.
Wildlife inherited Helmshore long ago. There is plenty of moorland for rambling. The{Tor Mile}race is an annual attraction. The top of the Tor provides the best view of the district.
In 1789{Higher Mill}was built by the Turner family. Today it is a museum with a working water wheel. Much farmland has been taken over by new housing estates in recent years.
An indoor public swimming pool and a modern{sports centre}cater for many activities.These facilities are much appreciated as it rains quite often.
